reviews.text: Such a pretty village in Somerset 🍁🥰
No toilets. Not manned. No ticket machine. Wheelchair accessible. Help point. Tiny free car park. The road to it is tiny and winding.

This station which is maintained by Great Western Railway has an hourly service in each direction (platform 1 for trains to Bath Spa - change here for trains in the direction on London Paddington, and the trains goes on to Bristol Temple Meads via the local stations and at Temple Meads, change for lines north and south)  - platform 2 for trains south to Westbury and beyond

This station has just been revamped with a lengthened platform on both sides to be able to take the longer "newer" trains that are passing though

Information includes train times, information board if it is working.

Footbridge and is about a 15 minute walk into the village where there is a pub and a village shop (run by the community for the community which has a café) The café is further out

Small free car park

The downside is that it is NOT manned no ticket machine (and tickets can be bought on the train (beware Bristol Temple Meads, Bath Spa and many other major stations have ticket barriers., so if it is not bought on the train you will need to buy it before leaving)

No toilets, but there are shelters

Gardens are maintained by volunteers

Freshford is a great area for walking
Peaceful charming station one platform great for walkers public footpath runs through the station

이곳은 정말 아름다운 곳입니다 bath에서 london으로 가는길에 잘못타서 이곳에 왔습니다.
이곳은 정말 환상적이에요.
